thread.title: Gabriel Jesus boost as Pep Guardiola reveals striker is likely to play again this season
thread.title_full: Gabriel Jesus boost as Pep Guardiola reveals striker is likely to play again this season

author: dwright
title: Gabriel Jesus boost as Pep Guardiola reveals striker is likely to play again this season

organizations.name: antonio conte no joshing manchester united

text:
CITY'S GAB BOOST Gabriel Jesus boost as Pep Guardiola reveals striker is likely to play again this season 
Manchester City star Jesus has been sidelined since breaking a bone in his foot in February By Martin Blackburn Comments PEP GUARDIOLA says he expects Gabriel Jesus to return from injury before the end of the season. 
The Brazilian teenager has been out since the middle of February after breaking his metatarsal at Bournemouth. Reuters 2 Gabriel Jesus has been out of action since February 
City initially predicted he would be out for two to three months – which potentially could have ended his campaign. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester City news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But he returned to Manchester on Wednesday after a spell back home and also helping with a promotional tour in New York. PA:Press Association 2 Jesus broke a bone in his foot at Bournemouth but Pep Guardiola says he is close to a comeback 
He is now off his crutches after more than six weeks and Guardiola believes he is on the road to recovery. 
The City boss said: “He was in New York. It was freezing. He told me that. The crutches are gone. 
“He has started to walk and hopefully he can come back to the pitches and start to run. 
“Hopefully he can help us in the last games of the season and come back for us in the pre-season.” Most read in football Gladbach confirm Andreas Christensen WILL return to Chelsea after ace impressed Antonio Conte No Joshing Manchester United open talks with Bayern Munich over deal for Joshua Kimmich – but City want him too BUILDING BRIDGES Eden Hazard 'agrees to new £300,000-a-week contract to stay at Chelsea'... as club offers John Terry one more year at Stamford Bridge NEIL ASHTON Luke Shaw is guaranteed the boot at Man Utd this summer... something has gone terribly wrong for him Spanner in Works Michael Keane is set leave Burnley for Liverpool or Everton, but his Man United sell-on clause is an issue RON NUMBER? Guardiola confirmed that Kevin de Bruyne and Pablo Zabaleta are available for the trip to Arsenal on Sunday. 
De Bruyne caused a scare when he pulled out of the Belgium squad with a minor groin problem a week ago. Sunday Premier League match preview featuring Arsenal v Man City
